comments:
Performing the following test.

Test Driver TPTP-4.2.0-200-04040100

Steps: 
  1. Profile an application to a file, collecting data for multiple packages, classes, methods.
  2. Go to the Import->Profiling File wizard
  3. Create or edit some import trace filter, enter a pattern for the package level.
  4. Click OK, import the trace file, ensure that the import trace filter is applied appropriately.
  5. Repeat the above steps for the class and method levels.
  6. Repeat the above steps for some tests, toggling the "Case sensitive" check box.

Results: 

It fails when a new filter is created or an existing filter is used for import. The error message is "An internal error cccured"
I could not reproduce the problem with tptp.sdk-TPTP-4.2.0-200604060100 driver.
Please reopen and attach the .log file when try with the latest build

Created an attachment (id=37994)
workspace .log file

generated using drive TPTP-4.2.0-200-04040100

Here is some additional info to reproduce it,

Create a filter and select the package radio button and type text like "java" in the text field. 

I re-test it with the driver TPTP-4.2.0-200-04040100 with a clean workspace. The .log file has been attached.
look at the exception in the log file; it should be fixed
Jack, Please get a more update driver, eg TPTP-4.2.0-200604060100 and anything post that, and try again.

Created an attachment (id=38005)
sample profiling file

Created an attachment (id=38006)
workspace .log file for driver TPTP-4.2.0-200604070923
Re-test it with the driver TPTP-4.2.0-200604070923, but it still fails. The resulting .log file has been attached.

I can reproduce the problem with the profile file attach.

Marius, Can you take a look. The file contains 3 different traces, and it fails in the import of the second TraceContent. Things run fine without filter.
The agMethodExit in the sample profiling file doesn't have methodIdRef, the filtering needs that in order to work, Bob is working on fixing this.
Fixed in 200604092039 internal driver as part of bug 135437.

Re-test it with driver: TPTP-4.2.0-200604101029

The following exception is thrown when importing a previously saved profiling file using a filter with "InOut" as the filtering string for class. The profiling file will be attached.
